definition: to sketch in light shades/to play down/to deemphasize (idiom)
to depict/to trace (a drawing)/to copy/to touch up
insipid/diluted/weak/mild/light in color/tasteless/indifferent/(variant of 氮[dan4]) nitrogen

sentences.english: Our textbook only skims the surface of the Vietnam War.
sentences.chinese: 我们的教科书对越南战争的描述只是轻描淡写。

sentences.english: ALDA's "improperly intrude" depiction is an understatement.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔达的“不当入侵”的描述是轻描淡写。

sentences.english: To say I was despondent is an understatement.
sentences.chinese: 说我有些沮丧已经算是轻描淡写了。

sentences.english: It seems that Jesus' human form was deliberately de- emphasized.
sentences.chinese: 圣经似乎刻意轻描淡写耶稣的样式外表。

sentences.english: The message here is quite simple-get off the need for foreign oil.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章对外国石油的需求相当轻描淡写。

sentences.english: She had, she explains with understatement, "a slight addiction".
sentences.chinese: 她轻描淡写地解释道，“有那么一点上瘾。”

sentences.english: These are just a few of the issues surfacing in the enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 这里只轻描淡写地提了几个企业里的问题。

sentences.english: To say that people are skeptical is the grossest understatement.
sentences.chinese: 说人们疑神疑鬼已经是轻描淡写啦。

sentences.english: Television has been accused of soft-pedalling bad news.
sentences.chinese: 有人指责电视对坏消息轻描淡写。

sentences.english: To call this a security hole is to understate the point woefully.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，将它称之为安全性漏洞有些轻描淡写。

sentences.english: The local news media have played down Japan's slip to third place.
sentences.chinese: 当地媒体对日本跌倒老三这事仅仅轻描淡写。

sentences.english: A direction given as a request is a managerial typeof understate ment.
sentences.chinese: 要求性的指示，就是“轻描淡写”在管理上的对应。

sentences.english: Misidentification is perhaps an understatement here.
sentences.chinese: 误认在这里也许是一种轻描淡写。

sentences.english: Comfortable life, holding a poetic pen, in the time of the book down.
sentences.chinese: 惬意生活，执一支如诗的笔，于流年的书轻描淡写。

definition: not a word or movement (idiom); remaining calm and collected/not batting an eyelid
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
to pay no attention to/not to mind
hardly/not in the least/not at all
to skate around/to skip over/to skimp
